alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:41PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Grafton, northwestern Belknap and southwestern Carroll Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Holderness, or near Plymouth, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plymouth, Meredith, Moultonborough, Holderness, Ashland, Danbury, Groton, Sandwich, Tamworth, Bristol, Alexandria, Center Harber, Bridgewater, Hebron, Ellsworth, Rumney, Campton, New Hampton, Thornton and Tuftonboro. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 68 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton
